column23: 2015 at john a. gentleman mortuaries 72nd street chapel. jerome b. ketteler
column28: nebraska to ted and lucy ketteler. jerome had a strong catholic faith and was a founding member of st. pius x church. he proudly served during wwii in the united states marine corps from 1942 to 1945. later in life he was fortunate enough to travel to europe several times exploring many countries and connecting with his german relatives. his main passion in life however was spending time with his family. jerome is survived by his children
column36: and sandy (mike) hansen of omaha; grandchildren
